str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Much, many; often.
A tear. Or dakruon dak'-roo-on; of uncertain affinity; a tear.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Much, many; often.
Persecution, affliction, distress, tribulation. From thlibo; pressure.
And, even, also, namely.
Distress, anguish, anxiety. From sunecho; restraint, i.e. anxiety.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To pain, grieve, vex. From lupe; to distress; reflexively or passively, to be sad.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.
Greatly, exceedingly, abundantly, vehemently. Adverb from perissos; superabundantly.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
